description:
In the year 2024, the world has collapsed. Grotesque monsters lurk amongst the ruins of Japan, while remaining people scrape together what they can to survive. Kiruko, an odd-job girl in Nakano, accepts a mysterious woman's dying wish to take a boy named Maru to a place called Heaven.

(Source: Disney+, edited)
synonyms: ถ้ำปีศาจแดนสวรรค์

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Pregnancy
tags.description: Features pregnant female characters or discusses the topic of pregnancy.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yujikaneko)

Founder and representative director of Aoshashin.

__[Website](https://www.agraph.jp/)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4L0gz16xuM1as1OgYzh1SR)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/agraph)__

Kensuke Ushio, alternatively known by stage name agraph, is a Japanese musician, DJ, composer, arranger, programmer, remixer and member of rock band [Lama](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/artist/lama/profile/).

When he was a child Kensuke learned to play the piano, while later at University he started studying arts and music, in addition to also learning how to use audio editing software like Pro Tools. At the age of 20, Kensuke first came in contact with the electronic music world known as techno. 

In 2007, he would start his solo career under the stage name agraph, this is when he started to create his own electronic music. His debut album titled A Day, Phases, produced by Takkyu Ishino, was released in December of 2008. Skipping to 2010, he would release his second album titled Equal which managed to rank in the Japanese Albums Charts.

In 2011, Kensuke and former musicians from the bands Supercar and Number Girl formed a rock band called Lama. The band has released two albums, which both managed to rank in the official Albums Charts of Japan.  It was later revealed that due to his involvement in the rock band Lama, he wouldn't be able to release a third album until 6 years after his second album. His third album titled The Shader was released in 2016.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/898885425028251648/)

Japanese composite artist. Currently working as a freelancer after being affiliated with Asahi Productions from 2011-2022, although he still keeps a desk at the studio for potential collaboration.

While his main focus is photography, he does animate on rare occasions, specifically [Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/)-esque effects animation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/utsushita_mina) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/45375792)

Founder and member of the animation studio [Minakata Laboratory](https://anilist.co/studio/6227/Minakata-Laboratory) (南方研究所).

Full name: Brand-new idol SHiT (Shinsei Kuso Idol, 新生クソアイドル)

A Japanese idol group that was founded in 2015 by their manager Watanabe Junnosuke.
